author: mmusich
body:
#### PR description:

The aim of this PR is fix various plots in Tracking DQM:
   * the `DistanceOfClosestApproachToBSdz` plot originally included in https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/27330 has x-axis range too small (actually ~ half of the statistics goes into the overflow bins right now, see e.g. https://tinyurl.com/smcjqap)
   * the target directory of the Tracking efficiency plots (using muons) is changed, solving long standing  issue https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/23614#issuecomment-412922438
   * the file ` DQM/TrackingMonitorSource/python/TrackingSourceConfigTier0_Cosmic_cff.py` is apparently an unused copy of `DQM/TrackingMonitorSource/python/TrackingSourceConfig_Tier0_Cosmic_cff.py`, so it is removed.

#### PR validation:

Minimal standard integration tests have been run:
   * `runTheMatrix.py -l 11634.0 -t 4 -j 8 --command='-n 100'`
   * `runTheMatrix.py -l 7.22,7.21,7.4,7.3,138.1 -t 4 -j 8`

The Beam Spot distance of closest approach with the new x-axis looks like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5082376/73396343-75398480-42e1-11ea-91c1-da9a941475b6.png)

#### if this PR is a backport please specify the original PR and why you need to backport that PR:

This is not a backport and no backport is intended.
cc:
@mtosi @sroychow @arossi83
title: Tracking DQM: miscellaneous fixes
